intro: Elatostema viridicarinatum, commonly known as the green-ribbed elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Elatostema viridicarinatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
